textRegions.text: “Day by day, the number of devices, platforms, and browsers that need to work with your site grows. Responsive web design represents a fundamental shift in how we’ll build websites for the decade to come.”
Not part of the SDK (sort of)
“Subtle effects contribute to a feeling of effortlessness and a sense that a powerful force is at hand.”
“The action bar is arguably the most important structural element of an Android app.”

notes.slide-12: Great app to leverage this: EventBoard, the app of questionable quality which holds the conference schedule
notes.slide-6: The pages are content and may not be prominent enough for first-level navigation
notes.slide-5:
Discoverability is key, if the user can’t immediately see it why would you expect them to find it?
Could argue action bar, tabs, etc. because it’s full bleed content paging.
notes.slide-3: The design pattern, library, and example topic will be done for each library: ActionBarSherlock, NineOldAndroids, ViewPagerIndicator, HanselAndGretel
notes.slide-1:
About me, libs, J-O-B
Impossible to write apps that work everywhere 
OEM ROM differences
App markets
Even device configurations presents challenges
but we can get damn close
Developer time is wasted dealing with platform differences
API changes
feature availability
functionality
progressive enhancement
notes.slide-26: Jelly beans in the bags. Announced after lightening talks.
